section.p: This document shows you the detailed description of tutorial and how to work with it.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: A Histogram is a graph that gives the information about the exposure of the captured frame. It gives details about the distribution of light on a picture.
The histogram explains which portions of the frame are over-exposed or under-exposed and helps you to adjust the captured frame accordingly.
You can display the histogram information directly on a viewfinder or analyze it using any analysis software.
